contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox military unit |unit_name=Essex County Division |image= |caption= |dates=18 February 1941-7 October 1941 |country=[[United Kingdom]] |allegiance= |branch=[[British Army]] |type=Static Division |role= |size= |command_structure= |current_commander= |garrison= |ceremonial_chief= |colonel_of_the_regiment= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |battles= |notable_commanders= |anniversaries= }} The '''Essex County Division''' was formed on 18 February 1941 by the redesignation of the [[British West Sussex County Division|West Sussex County Division]]. It lasted until 7 October when it was disbanded. It had one commanding officer, Major General J. H. T. Priestman, and commanded the [[British 207th Independent Infantry Brigade (Home)|207th Independent Infantry Brigade (Home)]], [[British 208th Independent Infantry Brigade (Home)|208th Independent Infantry Brigade (Home)]] and [[British 223rd Independent Infantry Brigade (Home)|223rd Independent Infantry Brigade (Home)]]. It was under the command of [[British XI Corps|XI Corps]] from formation to 22 July and then under [[British GHQ Home Forces|GHQ Home Forces]]. {{Clr}} {{British Divisions in World War II}} [[Category:British county divisions|Essex]] [[Category:British World War II divisions|Essex]]
